intro: Thysanostigma siamense, commonly known as the Siam star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, aromatic fruits that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its leaves are often used in herbal remedies due to their medicinal properties. Thysanostigma siamense thrives in tropical climates and is often found in forested areas.
